intro: Cyrtandra disparoides subsp. inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its subtle appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and delicate growth habits, it is considered a rare and less conspicuous member of its genus.
